title: Ticket #241: File Transfer plugins
description:
We want to allow URL-style file names for specifying the job's sandbox, e.g. transfer_input_files and transfer_output_files. Currently all files handled by the file transfer object are assumed to live on the submit machine, and are fetched by the starter via the shadow.

For 7.4.0, URLs will only be supported for transfer_input_files. Supporting transfer_output_files will have to wait until the next series.

Immediate Plan

  1. Allow job sandbox file names to have URLs that allow a file transfer plugin to be called (via a well-defined API) by the File Transfer Object to actually move the file in to the execute (or spool) directory. DONE

  2. Implement and demonstrate HTTP plugin. DONE

  3. Implement and demonstrate globus.org plug. DONE

  4. Implement and demonstrate HDFS (hadoop filesystem) plugin. DONE

  5. Add support for transfer_output_directory for using plugins to move job output. DONE

Status

The code is written and compiles and is checked into the V7_3_2-filetransfer_plugin-branch. Major changes are in condor_c++_util/file_transfer.[cpp|h] and the creation of the new directory condor_filetransfer_plugins.

The code passed simple tests. More testing to come, and a test needs to be added to the test suite. Known and suspected problems documented below.

Details

The new file transfer command (5) will not be sent unless you set ENABLE_URL_TRANSFERS to True.

When the FileTransfer object is instatiated, SimpleInit() now calls the function InitializePlugins(). This function params for FILETRANSFER_PLUGINS which should be a comma separated list of invokable plugins. These are invoked one at a time with the "-classad" option to find out their capabilities. See the API description below for details.

The plugin is then entered into a hash table keyed on each of its supported methods.

In FileTransfer::DoUpload(), if the file to be sent looks like a URL, according to the function isUrl(), then a different filetransfer command is sent. NOTE: this is not a different daemoncore command, it is a different integer as part of the DoUpload() protocol. (0 == still means "finished", 1 == normal,..., 4 == delagate proxy). now, 5 means "i'm sending you a URL, and you download it".

The basename (filename to write on the DoDownload() side) is still decided by the sender, so filename remaps should still work even with URLs.

In DoDownload(), if we received command 5, we then read the URL and attempt to retreive it. We find the type of the URL (up to the first ':'), look that up in the plugin_table hash table, and invoke the plugin. The current API to the plugin follows. NOTE: this format is going to change, as it has serious limitations. The limitations and suggested new format are below.

invoking the plugin with the '-classad' should produce something like this: 

  PluginVersion = "zkm! or maybe v0.1, or maybe a monotonically increasing int"
  PluginType = "FileTransfer"
  SupportedMethods = "http,ftp,file"

otherwise, it is assumed that the first argument is the URL, and the second is the local filename to write the contents to.

See the file src/condor_filetransfer_plugins/plugin-prototype for an example.

PROBLEMS WITH THIS PLUGIN API:

passing the URL on the command line sucks for a couple reasons:

  1. passwords for ftp and http can currently only be supplied by encoding them in the URL. they may be visible to other users by running 'ps'. example: http://zmiller:mypass@www.cs.wisc.edu/index.html

  2. there are limits on the length of command-line arguments (relatively small ones too if i remember), so the "data:" type becomes quite a bit less useful.

so, i was thinking this would be better: 

command line options:
        <none>          print usage?
        [-]-help        print usage.
        -classad        print classad (PluginType, PluginVersion, SupportedMethods)
        -get            process stdin as a classad and do what it says

with option '-get' (and eventually -put?) stdin will have a classad explaining
what to do.
        SourceURL = url://to.the.place/and/directory/to/find/the_file
        DestFile = /full/path/to/local/filename

then, the plugin dumps the contents to stdout.

progress information is (optionally) reported on stderr. format of this is undefined for now.

then, condor will select() on both stdout and stderr of the plugin. if both are inactive for some amount of time, it will be aborted.

this way, simple plugins can simply dump the contents to stdout and be done with it. more advanced ones (robotic tape fetching plugins) can write progress information on stderr to keep the transfer alive if that data itself takes a while.

OTHER PROBLEMS WITH THE NEW FILETRANSFER CODE:

1) this problem was resolved. move along.

2) i'm not sure if the shadow will timeout if for example, the starter is downloading a 2GB file.

3) i haven't tested remaps

4) this problem was resolved. move along.

5) when using remaps, the quoting is potentially messy. in transfer_input_files, things are separated with commas. URLs that contain commas should probably be encoded using the %2C method. also, in the remaps, equal signs and semicolons are special and need quoting.

6) the plugin API should be changed (see above)

that's all for now.
remarks:
2010-Sep-28 16:48:42 by matt:
This is marked as fixed in 7.5.3, was it released already? If so -> Resolved, if not Fixed Version -> 7.5.4?5?

2010-Dec-16 11:25:37 by tannenba:
Steve Tueke @ Argonne just informed me that globus.org now supports a protocol version command. the globus.org hook should definitely take advantage of this to enable backwards compatibility as the globus.org interface/protocol continues to evolve, or at the very least, so a decent error message can be propagated if an incompatible version is detected.

2010-Dec-16 11:31:08 by tannenba:
Fyi - Milestone deadline of March 2011 (for CEDPS) of running 100,000 jobs via CMS glideins using globus.org for file transfer.
2011-Jan-27 14:21:33 by danb:
Bulk change of target version from v070505 to v070506 using ./ticket-target-mover.
2011-Feb-01 14:49:30 by tannenba:
Bulk change of target version from v070506 to NULL using ./ticket-target-mover.
